ETYMOLOGY: From Old English ofen, from Proto-Germanic *ufnaz, from Proto-Indo-European *upno-, from the root *au-/*uH- ('to burn'). Cognate with German Ofen.

MEANINGS.PATTERN:
[an] oven
the oven | put [sth] in the oven
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An enclosed compartment, usually part of a cooker or a separate appliance, that is heated for baking, roasting, or warming food.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用于烘烤、炙烤或加热食物的封闭隔间，通常是炊具的一部分或独立的电器。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She baked a delicious cake in the oven for her son's birthday.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她为儿子生日在烤箱里烤了一个美味的蛋糕。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A large-scale or specialized heating apparatus used in industrial processes (e.g., for drying, curing, or firing materials) or for specific non-culinary purposes.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在工业生产（例如，用于干燥、固化或烧制材料）或特定非烹饪目的中使用的L型大型或专用加热设备。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The factory uses a large industrial oven to cure the paint on the metal parts.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 工厂使用大型工业烤箱来固化金属部件上的油漆。
